citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Tacoma, WA - Land Cover by Block Group

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research and Development (ORD) - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment (CPHEA))

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This EnviroAtlas dataset describes the breakdown of the land cover classes with each Census Block Group. In this community, forest is defined as Trees & Forest, and Woody Wetlands. Green space is defined as Trees & Forest, Grass & Herbaceous, Woody Wetlands, and Emergent Wetlands.Wetlands are defined as Woody Wetlands and Emergent Wetlands. This dataset also includes the area per capita for each block group for some land cover types. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. This dataset was produced the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. This dataset was produced the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: The purpose of this dataset is to show the differences in land cover amounts between the block groups in the EnviroAtlas community boundary. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment CPHEA, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: Begin with the Census Block Groups and the 1-Meter Land Cover Classification for the EnviroAtlas community.
Convert the Block Groups to Raster snapped to the land cover, with 1 meter pixels.
Tabulate the area of each land cover class within each block group.

Rename VALUE_## fields to their abbreviated land cover class and "_M". If any of the LC classes were not evaluated in the community, add the field for that LC and calculate all records = 0. In this community, Shrubs, Agriculture, and Orchards were not evaluated.

Use the block group tabulate area table to calculate block group land cover combinations: LandA_M = Impervious + Soil & Barren + Trees & Forest + Shrubs + Grass and Herbaceous + Agriculture + Orchards + Woody Wetlands + Emergent Wetlands; MFor_M = Trees & Forest + Woody Wetlands + Orchards; Green_M = Trees & Forest + Shrubs + Grass and Herbaceous + Agriculture + Orchards + Woody Wetlands + Emergent Wetlands; Ag_M = Agriculture + Orchards; Wet_M = Woody Wetlands + Emergent Wetlands. Note, if certain classes were not evaluated in this community, they will have 0 values in these fields.

Calculate the percentage of the block group area that is forest, impervious, green space, wetlands, and agriculture using the total land area. Note, if certain classes were not evaluated in this community, they will have 0 values in these fields.

Calculate the area per capita of impervious, forest, green space, and agriculture cover using SUM_POP10 from the block group shapefile. Note, if certain classes were not evaluated in this community, they will have 0 values in these fields.
Calculate fields where SUMPOP10 = 0: Area Per Capita fields = -99999.
Calculate fields Ag_M, Ag_P, and Ag_PC = -888888 to indicate that Agriculture was not evaluated in this community's land cover.
Copy the table to the final geodatabase, removing extraneous fields.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment CPHEA, EnviroAtlas

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development - Center for Public Health and Environmental Assessment CPHEA, EnviroAtlas

enttyp.enttypd: Land Cover summaries by block group.

attr.attrdef: Census Block Group Identifier; A concatenation of the current state Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code, county FIPS code, census tract FIPS code, and block group FIPS code.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS.38-200x (R2004), Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States (Formerly FIPS 5-2), INCITS.31-200x (R2007), Codes for the Identification of the Counties and Equivalent Areas of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States (Formerly FIPS 6-4), and the census tract code found in TRACTCE10 and block group number found in BLKGRPCE10

attr.attrdef: Tree cover area (m2). Includes trees/forest and woody wetlands, where evaluated.
Greenspace area (m2). Includes trees/forest, shrubs, grass/herbaceous, agriculture, woody wetlands, and emergent wetlands, where evaluated.
Agriculture area (m2). Includes orchards, where evaluated.

edom.edomvd: This layer was not calculated in the community. The record is here as a place holder

attr.attrdef: Wetland area (m2). Includes woody and emergent wetlands, where evaluated.

overview.eaover:
These layers describe the land cover within each block group.
Processing steps completed using python scripts.
A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
